*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to---------, Matamoros [July 1, 1832]. The revolution at Matamoros.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*This *location_mentioned*nation */location_mentioned*is in a dreadful situation—it seems to be necessary that they should pass through an ordeal—a kind of revolutionary furnace, to purify them from the hereditary evils which unfit them for republicanism—the present struggle is between the *person_mentioned*democratic republican federal party,*/person_mentioned* commonly called the *person_mentioned*Santana party,*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*aristocratic central party*/person_mentioned*. I think the result of the present civil war will be the election of a *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*who is not a *person_mentioned*military man*/person_mentioned*, and the organization of a *person_mentioned*democratic administration*/person_mentioned* for the next four years— The *location_mentioned*port of the Brazo Santiago*/location_mentioned* and the city of *location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned* containing about 10,000 *person_mentioned*inhabitants*/person_mentioned*, were taken peaceable possession of on the *date_mentioned n="06-25-1832">25 */date_mentioned*and *date_mentioned n="06-28-1832">28 June*/date_mentioned* by *person_mentioned*Col. José Antonio Mexia*/person_mentioned*, The old *person_mentioned*garrison*/person_mentioned* quietly marched off one way and the others marched in—not one drop of blood has been shed, nor one cent of private property lost or interfered with. No *person_mentioned*foreigners */person_mentioned*here, not even *person_mentioned*naturalized citizens*/person_mentioned*, have taken any part whatever, tho that will not prevent them from being unjustly censured by the other *person_mentioned*party*/person_mentioned*, who would no doubt be well satisfied to see them all expelled the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Mexia */person_mentioned*came from *location_mentioned*Tampico */location_mentioned*by water. The result of his expedition is doubtfull for it is said that *person_mentioned*Genl. Teran*/person_mentioned* is near with his *person_mentioned*troops*/person_mentioned*—those who left here expected to meet him—*person_mentioned*Mexia */person_mentioned*has about two hundred and fifty *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*. His conduct so far has been very correct and highly honorable to him as a *person_mentioned*soldier */person_mentioned*and as a man. The *person_mentioned*Governor of the State of Tamaulipas, Don Vital Fernandez*/person_mentioned* accompanied *person_mentioned*Mexia */person_mentioned*from *location_mentioned*Tampico*/location_mentioned*, where the events of the revolution forced him to seek refuge from the *person_mentioned*aristocratic party*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
